Title: AtCoder Regular Contest 190 (Div. 1)
Name: L Partition
Problem Statement:
There is an N \times N grid. Let (i,j) denote the cell at the i-th row from the top and the j-th column from the left.
For K = 1, 2, ..., N, a level K L-shape is a set of 2K - 1 cells that satisfies at least one of the following four conditions:
- All cells reachable from a certain cell (i,j) by moving down or right between 0 and K-1 cells, inclusive (where 1 ≤ i ≤ N-K+1, 1 ≤ j ≤ N-K+1).
- All cells reachable from a certain cell (i,j) by moving down or left between 0 and K-1 cells, inclusive (where 1 ≤ i ≤ N-K+1, K ≤ j ≤ N).
- All cells reachable from a certain cell (i,j) by moving up or right between 0 and K-1 cells, inclusive (where K ≤ i ≤ N, 1 ≤ j ≤ N-K+1).
- All cells reachable from a certain cell (i,j) by moving up or left between 0 and K-1 cells, inclusive (where K ≤ i ≤ N, K ≤ j ≤ N).
You are given a cell (a,b) and Q queries k_1, ..., k_Q.
For each i, print the number, modulo 998244353, of ways to partition the entire grid into exactly one level 1 L-shape, one level 2 L-shape, ..., and one level N L-shape so that cell (a,b) is contained in the level k_i L-shape.
Constraints:
- 1 ≤ N ≤ 10^7
- 1 ≤ a ≤ N
- 1 ≤ b ≤ N
- 1 ≤ Q ≤ \min\lbrace N, 200000 \rbrace
- 1 ≤ k_1 < \cdots < k_Q ≤ N
- All input values are integers.
IO Styles:
Input
The input is given from Standard Input in the following format:
N a b
Q
k_1 \cdots k_Q
Output
Print Q lines.
The i-th line should contain the number, modulo 998244353, of ways to partition the grid into exactly one level 1 L-shape, one level 2 L-shape, ..., and one level N L-shape so that cell (a,b) is contained in the level k_i L-shape.

Sample Detail.explanation:
The six ways shown in the following figure are the solutions. In the figure, an integer k in a cell means that the cell belongs to the level k L-shape.
